name: 李鎮宇
objective: This course introduces data science and data visualization through the R language. Focusing on applied data science skills, students will be introduced to the methods to tidy, explore, transform, and visualize data. Students will practice them with real data in exercises and projects.
schedule:
1.	Introduction to course
2.	Data preparation
3.	Univariate Analysis and Visualization
4.	Bivariate Analysis and Visualization
5.	Multivariate Analysis and Visualization
6.	Maps
7.	Time-series Analysis and Visualization
8.	Statistical Models and Visualization
9.	Other Advanced Visualization
10.	Customization of Graphs 1
11.	Customization of Graphs 2

Advanced topics: Data science techniques
12.	Datasets and data structures
13.	Data management
14.	Advanced data management
15.	Advanced programming
scorePolicy:
Participation, Classwork & Homework 	25 %
Quizzes 	 	 	 	 	 	 	25 %
Midterm 	 	 	 	 	 	 	25%
Final report						25 %
Total						       100%
materials:
Textbook: Data Visualization with R, Rob Kabacoff
Reference: R in Action: Data Analysis and Graphics with R, Robert Kabacoff, Manning Publications, 2015
consultation: Send LINE or email message to the instructor.
